newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela 9-month imports off 14.3 pct to $7 bln.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela 9-month imports off 14.3 pct to $7 bln.

text.p: The value of Venezuelan imports over the first three quarters of 1996 dropped 14.3 percent to $7.034 billion, compared to $8.204 billion in 1995, according to the Central Office of Statistics and Information (OCEI).
An overvalued currency saw imports in Venezuela rise 45 percent to $11.156 billion last year.
The private sector accounted for the vast majority of imports over the nine-month period with 86.1 percent of the total.
Electrical equipment was the biggest category of imports with 28.2 percent of the total. Chemical products followed with 14.1 percent, then foodstuffs with 9.9 percent.
The U.S. was the top exporter to Venezuela with 44.2 percent, followed by Colombia with 8.4 percent, Germany with 4.5 percent, and Brazil with 4.4 percent, the OCEI said.
